RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COWGIRL ATTITUDE accelerated to the front passing the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled in the stretch. DIXIE YODELER chased inside through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, eased out toward the head of the lane and dug in to take second the final strides while gaining on the winner. JACKYSINTHECASTLE chased the early pace toward mid track, rounded the turn near the rail and was outfinished for second the final strides. LEMONSONDESURPRISE pressured the pace after an early lead, remained a close factor off the rail through the turn but flattened the final sixteenth. BLUE MOUNTAIN chased the early pace toward the outside, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. FIFTY GRAY SHADES chased outside through the backstretch, drifted wider on the turn then lugged in through the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie Yodeler
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,up 2nd late,gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Cowgirl Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: up past 3/8,set pressured pace,rail turn,steady handling lane

ENTRY.NAME: Fifty Gray Shades
ENTRY.COMMENT: chase outside,drifted wide turn,lugged in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED TWO YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In We ight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARSHALL PEANUT was bumped outward and into Powered By Love leaving the gate then angled to the inside and rated the pace, raced at the rail on the turn, was kept sharp to late stretch then taken in hand. DORADO chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and dug in to hold second. GOLD CREATIONS chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly down the lane. LONA LEE was reluctant to load then gave early chase outside, raced in the three path on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and passed rivals in the lane. ROBBIELIKESHIM ducked out and made contact with Marshall Peanut leaving the gate then gave chase, raced between horses in the three path on the turn then flattened stride. POWERED BY LOVE was bumped lightly leaving the gate then chased toward the outside, raced in the five path on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Marshall Peanut
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,angled in,rated pace,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Lona Lee
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load,chased,3p turn,eased out 1/8,passed rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MEETMEATTHEBEACH chased outside through the backstretch, dueled for the nod two deep approaching the eighth pole and was steadily handled to hold on. PURE NONSENSE chased toward the inside through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and dug in to take second late yards. CASTLE TOY came away awkwardly but took a quick lead and set a pressured pace, was met at the rail approaching the head of the lane, remained a close factor through the upper stretch but relented with a sixteenth to go. WHALE OF A TIME chased the early pace toward mid track, raced at the rail on the turn and finished evenly to pass some rivals. LINDA'S TAJ gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened in the lane. ASUE gave chase toward the outside, rounded the turn in the five path and showed little in the lane. SMOKIN LADY chased outside through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUNALDO gave chase and took the lead three wide past the quarter pole, dug in leaving the turn and edged clear later yards. MY BALBOA contested the pace with a slim early lead, was met past the quarter pole, relented mid-stretch and settled for second. CECIL THE GREAT pressured the pace and contested even terms at the rail on the turn, dug in a close factor through the upper stretch but flattened the final sixteenth. AREYOUGONNAKISSME pressured the pace through most of the backstretch but was checked from between horses nearing the quarter pole, rounded the turn off the rail and weakened. BORN TO SIN came away a bit awkwardly then gave chase, rounded the turn in the four path and showed little in the lane. EVANESCO gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. TIME TO CHOOSE gave chase and rounded the turn about the three path.

ENTRY.NAME: Areyougonnakissme
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,checked between near 1/4,off rail turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Les s Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAGTIME RICHES saved ground off the pace, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and closed to the front in the four path approaching the eighth pole, dueled clear mid-stretch then widened in hand the final sixteenth. KASIMBA tapered in and stalked from the three path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close between horses toward the head of the lane then dueled through the stretch for second. VOICE OF NOW rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, was met at the rail approaching the head of the lane and relented in the stretch duel for second. COUNTRY CHARLIE saved ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. SCOTCH NO ROCKS settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and weakened in the lane. SEIZE THE BREEZE raced off the rail the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. PERSONAL FINANCE raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. GUN COLLECTOR was eased shortly after the start and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Kasimba
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John and Longball Stables LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YOLO CHARLOTTE dropped back from a brief early lead inside then stalked off the rail, challenged nearing the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead two deep past the quarter pole, drew clear nearing the head of the lane and was kept sharp to draw off. JUMPIN JACK BRASS saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the turn about the three path and cleared second nearing mid-stretch. LUCKY BOP settled inside through the opening turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, steadied and altered course from the heels of Jumpin Jack Brass past the eighth pole and came along for third mid-stretch. XANTHE settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. XTENDED STREAK took over nearing the three quarter pole and tapered to the inside to show the way, dug in to the challenge Yolo Charlotte leaving the seven sixteenths pole and kept the edge through the backstretch, but was met past the quarter, continued close at the rail on the far turn then weakened in the lane. LONG LEGS LOUISE was bumped leaving the gate and saved ground. SPARKLEINYOUREYE was bumped outward and into Long Legs Louise leaving the gate, raced two deep on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. IHEARTRAINACOMN ducked out and made contact with Sparkleinyoureye leaving the gate then stalked from the four path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Xanthe
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Xtended Streak
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,dug in from 7/16,met past 1/4,rail turn,weaken

ENTRY.NAME: Long Legs Louise
ENTRY.OWNER: Rogers Louie and Lewis Jr William R

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since November 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since October 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLDEN KEY took an immediate lead while angling to the inside and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn at the rail and held on well with steady handling. DERBY DAY DREAMS gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the five path then dug in from the head of the lane and took second under the wire. AMIDSHIPS broke awkwardly then gave chase, raced near the rail on the turn, dug in leaving the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch, then nipped from second under the wire. MR TINGLES gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted leaving the turn then flattened later yards. PIT STOP MAN gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the six path and finished evenly to pass rivals. ROCKET APPEAL gave chase then weakened at the rail on the turn. INSIDE RISK chased through the backstretch, entered the turn near the rail, angled out approaching the head of the lane and showed little more. GOLDEN G angled to the outside to give chase, rounded the turn about the seven path and passed rivals widest. COMPANY CLOWN came away awkwardly and saved ground. WILD MULE gave chase and rounded the turn near the rail.

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Key
ENTRY.COMMENT: immediate lead,set pressured pace,rail turn,held well driving

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Francis W. Daniel III & Ronney W. Brown

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAPTAP exchanged contact with NINETY PROOF leaving the gate then pressured the pace, contested the turn two deep, dug in under steady encouragement and got up the final strides. The latter exchanged contact with Taptap leaving the gate then pressured the pace, raced close at the rail on the turn, dueled through the stretch and took second the final strides. CREME DE LA QUEEN set a pressured pace inside, rounded the turn at the rail and dug in leaving the eighth pole, but was nipped in the final strides. RUMORGOINGAROUND gave chase, rounded the turn in the four path and ran evenly in the lane. JUNIPER GRACE veered in and made contact with Pretty Castle leaving the gate then gave chase, raced in the six path on the turn and passed rivals outside. BABY BREEZE chased, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. PRETTY CASTLE was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase to no avail. EVEN SMARTER steadied at the break then gave chase and rounded the turn about the four path. MIREYA chased inside, steadied at the rail approaching the five sixteenths pole then weakened on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Juniper Grace
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in,bumped break,chased,6p turn,passed rivals outside

ENTRY.NAME: Creme de La Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steady urging lane,nipped near wire

ENTRY.NAME: Ninety Proof
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,pressed pace,rail turn,dueled,2nd final strides

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Taptap
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,pressed pace,2d turn,dug in lane,up final strides
